Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 01:29PM - edited Sep 25, 2010 04:00PM by loonlover I had lumpectomy and radiation three years ago. Scars from that surgery are barely visible. After multiple biopsies on same side (no cancer), decided with surgeon's agreement to have prophylactic bilateral mastectomies and get this over with since my risk of recurrence was over 20%. The stitches came out today. I'm appalled at how the scars look. They look crooked, puckered, and have big "saddlebags" under each arm. Surgeon  (who also did the first surgery) apologized for the "extra skin" and said he could  do a revision after this one heals. I live in a rural area with no PS in the immediate area to consult. Has anyone had to deal with this? I didn't plan on having reconstruction, but am wondering how it could even be done with scars like I have. I knew the scars wouldn't be pretty, but wasn't prepared for this. Would it be better to have a PS do the revision? Cost isn't a factor. I live in Ontario and I believe it would be covered. I have been so pleased with my surgeon so far, so don't know how to approach this.

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2010 09:20AM loonlover wrote: I had BMX three weeks ago today--prophylactic, so no lymph nodes removed. I haven't had a huge amount of pain, but do have "pins and needle", "crawley" sensations all around the incisions and right to the back of my arms. My chest from collar bone to below incisions is very sensitive to touch. I had rads 3 years ago after lumpectomy, and that side is not healing as fast as the other side. It's very hard and distorted, but the discomfort seems to be on both sides. I also tend to feel cold even though I'm normally very warm blooded. I also feel better in a soft bra, but if I wear it more than a few hours, it starts feeling very tight. I don't have TE's and don't plan on reconstruction, but will likely be having scar revision surgery in a few months.
Posts.Title: Been 3 wks.--what's "normal pain" after BMX? Joanne58 Joanne58

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2010 06:42PM loonlover wrote: I had prophylactic BMX a month ago. Diagnosed 3 years ago with IDC and had lumpectomy then radiation. Several biopsies later, I decided to go ahead with the BMX. My non-radiated side is healing about as I expected. I have large dog ears on both sides, which the surgeon plans to take off in a few months. The radiated side is a different story. I have large, raised, very hard ridges along most of the scar, especially bad where the original lumpectomy scar was (which was almost invisible after 3 years, and where most of the radiation occurred). I haven't seen the surgeon for follow-up yet, so don't know what he will recommend. I didn't want to go though the additional surgery for reconstruction and was planning to go "flat", but it seems that the only way to get rid of this scarring is to have DIEP or some other "own tissue" reconstruction. Apparently, the radiation damages the skin forever. I wish someone had told me that when I had to make the original decision between lumpectomy and rads or MX.
